title: Simon Sight: Camera Coverage Control Game
excerpt: Explored OpenCV to detect dark/light pixel ratios for camera coverage control, resulting in 'camera buttons' and a quick Simon game.
author: Codem
content:
Project Overview: Simon Sight

Exploring OpenCV, I delved into the concept of ratios of dark to light pixels. Using this, I created a program that detects total camera coverage.

This allowed me to create, essentially, camera buttons. I also made a separate program to initiate and stop cameras, giving me control of both the LED on the camera and its coverage control.

Simon Sight Game Implementation

Using these controls, I put together a quick Simon game program complete with sounds from a speaker and webcams for both buttons and lights. I've named this project the Simon Sight.

You can check it out on the portfolio if you want to try it out, the GitHub repo is open for modification and use!
